Award.AwardTitle: International Conference on Graph Theory and Applications
Award.AbstractNarration:
This award supports participation in the International Conference on Graph Theory and Applications, held at Middle Tennessee State University in Murfreesboro, Tennessee from August 15, 2015 to August 17, 2015. The aim of this conference is to bring experts and junior researchers together to discuss recent advances in graph theory and applications, and to exchange ideas for future research. More information is available on the conference website http://mtsu.edu/GTA2015.

The focus of the conference is on topology and geometry properties of graphs, which have strong connections with other areas of mathematics, such as group theory, matrix theory, discrete geometry and optimization etc. The conference will feature six plenary speakers: Michel Deza, Fan Chung Graham, Douglas Klein, Bojan Mohar, Wendy Myrvod and Teresa M. Przytycka. While there are many conferences on graph theory each year, conferences focusing on geometric and topological aspects of graph theory are rare. This conference will provide an opportunity for researchers working on topological and geometric properties of graphs to present recent research results and to identify new directions for future research.

ProgramReference.Text: EXP PROG TO STIM COMP RES

POR.DRECONTENT:
The 2015 International Conference on Graph Theory and Applications was held at Middle Tennessee State University in Murfreesboro, TN from August 15 to August 16, 2015. The conference was sponsored by the National Science Foundation and by Middle Tennessee State University.  The conference attracted over 70 researchers, including 18 women, 21 students (including 1 undergraduate) and 16 junior faculties.

One goal of the conference was so that geographically distant researchers might gather together in order to share research results in graph theory and applications in related areas such as topology, geometry and algebra. Another goal was so that researchers in graph theory might collaboratively explore further research directions in an energetic and safe intellectual atmosphere.  The conference was held in a location central to many researchers in the mid-South region of the United States. To help stimulate ideas among the regional attendees, many well-known national and international researchers were also invited.

The conference featured six plenary speakers: Douglas Klein, Xueliang Li, Bojan Mohar, Wendy Myrvold, Teresa Przytycka and Cun-Quan Zhang. The conference also featured 30 contributed talks in graph theory and applications in related areas. The talks were conveniently scheduled in two parallel sessions.   

The NSF grant supported 22 participants: 5 plenary speakers and additional 15 participants. Supportees included 5 women, 7 graduate students, and 5 junior faculties.

The conference website is available at http//:mtweb.mtsu.edu/gta2015conference

 


Last Modified: 01/07/2016
Modified by: Dong Ye
